questionnaire.name: 4. theBIKEnet Safety Behaviour - How you protect yourself

sections.title: theBIKEnet Safety Behaviour Questionnaire
sections.description:
ðŸš² theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This fourth questionnaire explores how you protect yourself and behave in traffic while cycling, including your confidence, safety practices, and reactions to different road situations. Understanding these everyday strategies helps us identify habits and needs that can guide safer riding behaviours and better infrastructure design.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Cycling Confidence
sections.description: How confident and comfortable you feel when handling your bicycle in different traffic and environmental conditions.

questions.text: I am confident in my ability to control my bicycle in different traffic situations.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: I am confident in my ability to handle my bicycle at higher speeds or on downhill sections.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: I feel anxious or tense when dealing with various traffic situations while cycling.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: I feel comfortable sharing the road with motor traffic when cycling.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

sections.title: Avoidance and Adaptive Behaviour
sections.description: When and where you choose to ride, and what strategies you use to stay safe.

questions.text: What actions do you take to feel safer when cycling? (Select up to 3 options)

options.text: Avoid riding at night or in low-light conditions
Ride against the traffic flow (wrong-way riding)
None (I do not take any specific actions)
Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: In some situations, how often do you deviate from traffic rules when cycling because you feel it is safer?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Which of the following situations have you occasionally engaged in when cycling? (Select up to 3 options)

options.text: Going the wrong way on one-way streets
Using headphones or earphones in a way that reduces awareness of traffic
Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Which types of road users most negatively affect your sense of safety when cycling? (Select up to 3 options)

options.text: None (no road users negatively affect my sense of safety)
Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

sections.title: Protective Behaviour
sections.description: How often and in what ways you protect yourself while cycling.

questions.text: How often do you wear a helmet when cycling?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Which safety equipment do you use regularly?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Do you usually cycle with lights or reflective items during the day?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Where do you usually position yourself when waiting at red lights when cycling?

options.text: In front of cars, in the lane
Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: How do you deal with tram tracks or similar obstacles when cycling?

options.text: I slow down and cross perpendicularly
I avoid them by changing route or lane
I cross at a shallow angle without slowing down
There are no tram tracks on my usual routes
Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

sections.title: Motivation and Social Norms
sections.description: Your reasons and social influences related to using safety equipment such as helmets or lights.

questions.text: I use safety equipment because it makes me feel safer when cycling.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: I use safety equipment because I believe it is required by law or regulation when cycling.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: I do not think safety equipment is necessary for short trips when cycling.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use bicycles)

questions.text: Most people I know use helmets or lights when cycling.

it.#Using sidewalks or pedestrian-only infr: Usare marciapiedi o infrastrutture riservate ai pedoni

it.#Beside cars, near the curb: Accanto alle auto, vicino al margine della carreggiata
it.#On the sidewalk or crosswalk: Sul marciapiede o sulle strisce pedonali

it.#I slow down and cross perpendicularly: Rallento e attraverso in modo perpendicolare
